intro: Mosiera baracoensis, commonly known as the Baracoan mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
